data.title: Die Überlebenschancen der syrischen Christen im Tur Abdin/Südosttürkei und im Irak
data.abstractNote: Addresses factors that evaluate the long-term prospects of a Christian presence in the regions of the Tur Abdin, south-eastern Turkey, as well as in Iraq. While Anschütz, also writing before the US invasion of Iraq, still had positive expectations for the Christian presence there, her analysis of the situation in the Tur Abdin is less promising. Restrictions regarding the exercise of Syriac language instruction for children, the discrimination of young men from the Syriac-speaking Christian community in military service, and repeated acts of forced expropriations of real estate property of Christians, as well as the gentrification of the Syrian-Christian population in the homeland and a desire on the part of Christians in the Tur Abdin to join family members who have reached a status of financial security in the West are key reasons that continue to contribute to the depopulation of the Christian landscape in south-eastern Turkey and to draw people to move westward. This tendency only intensifies a behavior that already characterizes the life of those who have gone into the diaspora. They suffer from a sense of loss of their roots and identity and they compensate for this by placing all their hopes in the acquisition of material goods.
data.bookTitle: Orientalische Christen zwischen Repression und Migration: Beiträge zur jüngeren Geschichte und Gegenwartslage

citation: Ioniţă Apostolache, “Dimensiunea Eclesiologică a Tainei Baptismale În Imnografia Siro-Occidentală. ‘Imn La Epifanie Despre Biserică, Mireasă a Lui Hristos,’” Revista Teologică 96:1 (2014): 25–41.

data.title: Dimensiunea eclesiologică a tainei baptismale în imnografia siro-occidentală. “Imn la Epifanie despre Biserică, Mireasă a lui Hristos”
data.abstractNote: The Syrian Traditions offers many symbolical ways of interpretation in Christian theology. In our study we have tried to discover the most important aspects of the dogmatic and mystical symbols of the Heavenly Bridegroom and the bridal chamber. In this respect, we try to analyze one baptismal hymn, written by an anonymous father. This text was translated from English. It is also very interesting the connection between the Sacrament of Baptism and the Christian symbols form the book "Song of Songs". His allegorical dimension is demonstrated in Origen and Saint Gregory's commentary. We tried to develop a very interesting subject, less analyzed in our theology. In conclusion, our work is supported by the great importance of the Syriac Theology, permanently in connection and dialogue with the world of Greek writings and concepts.

data.title: The Pastoral Care of the Syro-Malabar Catholic Migrants
data.abstractNote: The author's Ph.D. work in Rome first traces the history of the Syro-Malabar Church and with a focus on migratory movements. The second section deals with rites and the different rites acceptable in the Roman Catholic communion in India. The third section then analyses all the main sources on pastoral care of both Latin and Oriental migrants. The fourth section considers specific ecclesiastical structures and offices for providing pastoral care to Syro-Malabar migrants. The conclusion lists practical suggestions. With a bibliography and index.
data.series: Oriental Institute of Religious Studies India Publications 170

data.abstractNote: «The aim of this paper therefore is to find out the characteristic features of the contemporary charismatic renewal mplied throughout the homily of Mar Narsai on pentecost. The main features we look for are: (1) Baptism in the Spirit (Effusion of the Holy Spirit), (2) Joyful praise, (3) Gift of Tongues, (4) Prophecy, 5) Healing, Renewal and conversion.» (P. 126)

data.abstractNote: «In order to get a systematic comprehensive view of Narsai's Pneumatology, this paper is divided mainly inlo four parts. In the first part the doctrinal aspect of his Pneumatology is explained; in the second, soteriological part of Narsai's pneurnatology is depicted. The third is ecclesiological and the fourth demonstrate the sacramental aspects of the theology or the Holy Spirit.» (P. 196)

citation: Arda Arikan, Ozan Varli, and Eyüp Yaşar Kürüm, “A Study of Assyrians’ Language Use in Istanbul,” Darnioji Daugiakalbystė 10 (2017): 56–74.

data.title: A Study of Assyrians’ Language Use in Istanbul
data.abstractNote: Being one of the oldest Christian communities in the Middle East, Assyrians have continued to live in various parts of Turkey for thousands of years. Today, the estimates related to the number of Assyrians living in Turkey vary between 4,000–25,000 while they cannot benefit from the rights put forward by the Lausanne Treaty among which schooling is the most important. Assyrian community can be said to be deteriorating in number. This decline in the number of Assyrians living in Turkey raises the question of whether they could maintain their ethnic identity while maintaining their language (Syriac). No studies so far have been carried out to find out the linguistic practices of Assyrian community living in Turkey, as well as their attitudes toward the languages they use. This study aims at shedding light on the present situation of Syriac used among the Assyrian community living in Turkey. The participants are limited to those living in Istanbul due to practical reasons. In this study, language attitudes and language use practices of Assyrian community living in Istanbul are found out through a language attitudes questionnaire. It is hoped that the results of the study will provide the current situation of the Syriac language in terms of its ethnolinguistic vitality as spoken among the community. It is also hoped that the results of the study will provide useful data for those who would like to help protect the ethnolinguistic identities of Assyrian minority in Turkey, as well as all those dispersed around the world, which seems to have become increasingly important for such a country at the gates of the European Union as Turkey.

bib: Ariño-Durand, Miguel. “La Vie de La Bienheureuse Vierge Marie Dans Les Traditions Apocryphes Syro-Orientales.” Thèse présentée pour l’obtention du doctorat conjoint en histoire des religions et anthropologie religieuse et en théologie, Université Paris-Sorbonne ‒ Paris IV / Institut Catholique de Paris, 2014.
citation: Miguel Ariño-Durand, “La Vie de La Bienheureuse Vierge Marie Dans Les Traditions Apocryphes Syro-Orientales” (Thèse présentée pour l’obtention du doctorat conjoint en histoire des religions et anthropologie religieuse et en théologie, Université Paris-Sorbonne ‒ Paris IV / Institut Catholique de Paris, 2014).

data.title: La Vie de la bienheureuse Vierge Marie dans les traditions apocryphes syro-orientales
data.abstractNote: A woman with a singular destiny, the Virgin Mary has caused interest, enthusiasm and even passion throughout the centuries of the Christian era. She has inspired artists, writers and preachers ; and her life has been the object of narratives to be imitated. The Life of the Virgin can be found over the course of the history of Syriac literature. There are no fewer than 23 Syro-Oriental manuscripts that have come down us. They are relatively recent. There were copied from 1243 to 1917 AD, with roots in much older texts. In the first volume, a copy of a manuscript from the end of the 13th century, kept at the monastery of Our Lady of the Seeds in Alqos̆, in modern day in Iraq, has been chosen, because of its exhaustiveness to serve as a complete edition and a first translation into french. It contains a very important critical apparatus since it compares 18 manuscripts, unfortunately, however, 5 manuscripts are not accessible currently. This apparatus complements this edition and allows for the establishment of a stemma which clarifies the existence of four families of manuscripts, with a single manuscript, that is a copy of an original Syro-Oriental version now lost. In the second volume, the commentary on the text underlines the uniqueness of this Syro-Oriental Christian apocryphal writing. It is clear that its author wants to announce Jesus Christ who, by his incarnation, comes to restore fallen creation to its original harmony and to redeem humanity. He does this by presenting the life of Mary, his mother. She is then the woman who transcends all times and places and becomes the in carnation of the "éternel féminin".
